metadata.title: CVE-2021-4157 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: An out of memory bounds write flaw (1 or 2 bytes of memory) in the Linuxkernel NFS subsystem was found in the way users use mirroring (replicationof files with NFS). A user, having access to the NFS mount, couldpotentially use this flaw to crash the system or escalate privileges on thesystem.
